answers.answer: Have you had a nuclear thyroid scan or a ultrsound?  It's my understanding that in order to have thyca you have to have a nodule and if a nodule is cancerous it its usually a cold nodule.  What course of treatment has your doctor recommended?  Drugs or RAI, or both?  With a TSH as low as yours, that's definitely sounds like hyperthyroidism.

Your TSH and FT-4 levels relate hyperthyroidism but without knowing your FT-3 level couldn't say classic case of Graves'.WOW, that's a high FT-4!?  Did you forget a decimal point?!  I wonder what your FT-3 is with a FT-4 like that.Normally cancer is not a Graves' issue.  However there is always that one case out of so many.

My personal opinion is that everyone who has a thyroid issue should be checked for cancer.  I am a nurse who does hospital reviews and if someone comes into the ER complaining of a problem w/ a certain area they usually do some kind of scan looking for a mass or cancer, especially if they can't find another answer for the problem.  My suggestion would be to get an endo that does a lot of thyroid care.  Many endos do mainly diabetes and aren't usually great @ thyroid care.  Some doctors are content with determining what the problem is & treating it - they aren't always interested in finding out the root of the problem.  If you don't know of any good endos in your area feel free to let us know where you live and one of us may know of someone to refer you to.  Welcome to our board and feel free to ask any questions you may have.Rayne

question: I've been diagnosed with Graves Disease in the last month.  I'm 39 y.o. with no family history of thyroid disease.  I have a medical background , although I know much Endocrinology, I asked my physician about testing for auto-antibodies that cause Graves, he wasn't interested.  My thyroid is 2X normal size and no nodules present. My only symptom was racing heart, however my blood showed T4 = 44, and TSH <0.004.  Although seems like a classic case of Graves, is cancer not a thought?
title: Newly diagnosed Graves
